title: Mandinka people
summary: The Mandinka or Malinke[note 1] are a West African ethnic group primarily found in southern Mali, the Gambia and eastern Guinea.[16] Numbering about 11 million,[17][18] they are the largest subgroup of the Mand√© peoples and one of the largest ethnic-linguistic groups in Africa. They speak the Manding languages in the Mande language family and a lingua franca in much of West Africa. Over 99% of Mandinka adhere to Islam. They are predominantly subsistence farmers and live in rural villages. Their largest urban center is Bamako, the capital of Mali.[19]
